meanings.definition: The act of renouncing or giving up something.
meanings.sent1: Her renouncement of the dessert showed her commitment to a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The renouncement of his claim to the throne surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: His renouncement of the last slice of pizza left his friends in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The renouncement of her fears empowered her to take on new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The renouncement of his old habits marked the beginning of a new chapter in his life.

meanings.definition: A formal declaration of renouncing something.
meanings.sent1: The king's renouncement of the crown was met with mixed reactions from the court.
meanings.sent2: The renouncement of his citizenship required a signed document.
meanings.sent3: His renouncement of the title was met with applause from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The renouncement of her membership in the club was a symbolic gesture.
meanings.sent5: The renouncement of his allegiance to the rival team shocked his friends.

meanings.definition: The act of rejecting or disowning something.
meanings.sent1: Her renouncement of the proposal left him heartbroken.
meanings.sent2: The renouncement of his former beliefs led to a period of self-reflection.
meanings.sent3: His renouncement of the family heirloom caused a stir at the reunion.
meanings.sent4: The renouncement of her past mistakes allowed her to move forward with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The renouncement of his responsibilities weighed heavily on his conscience.
